decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The side roof extension, by reason of its design, scale and position, would not appear sufficiently subordinate to the existing roof and it would represent a visually intrusive form of development which would have an unacceptable impact on the character and appearance of the area and the property itself, contrary to adopted Unitary Development Plan policies ENV-B.1.1 (New Development) and H.6.4. (Extensions and Alterations) as well as emerging Local Plan policy SC7 (Residential Extensions and Alterations) and the intent of the Residential Extension Guidelines.

Condition : 2 - The ground floor side extension, due its excessive width and design, would not appear sufficiently subordinate to the original dwellinghouse and as such would significantly detract from the character of the property and would cause undue harm to the appearance of the surrounding area. This would be contrary to adopted Unitary Development Plan policies ENV-B.1.1 (New Development) and H.6.4. (Extensions and Alterations) as well as emerging Local Plan policy SC7 (Residential Extensions and Alterations) and the intent of the Residential Extension Guidelines
description: Demolition of garage, erection of a single storey side extension, erection of side and rear dormer windows to facilitate a loft conversion, instalation of rooflights.
